This is what is called *Stepping the Dipper to Face Heaven*.
It can cure illness and avert misfortune,
It can nurture the true and cultivate practice,
It can fulfill one’s utmost filial piety,
It can command ghosts and spirits.
The Four Saints of Heavenly Torch,
And all the Perfected of every rank,
None fail to come in welcome.
At this time, Heaven bestows numinous elixir:
To the left, seven bonds form the Lord of the Sun;
To the right, seven slayers form the Lord of the Moon.
Swallowing and breathing—
This is the true elixir.
There is the odd, there is the even,
There is the yang, there is the yin.
The elixir of yin and yang,
When ingested, grants long life.
Some attain extended lifespan,
Some achieve liberation through *shi*-transformation and become Perfected.
Some gain penetrating vision,
Able to scrutinize the hundred spirits.
The secret of Heaven’s Center,
The scripture of Heaven’s Center,
The office of Heaven’s Center,
The duty of Heaven’s Center—
Each is attained within the body,
Not necessarily through a master’s transmission,
But arising from Heaven’s completion.
What is Heaven’s completion?
The method of *Facing Heaven*.
Through it, one may wondrously enter the Supreme,
And naturally reach the *Beginning Azure*.
At this time,
The Ten Heavenly Demon Kings,
The Great Gods of Long Life,
The True Emperors of the Five Directions,
Guard and protect one’s form.
Like the sun and moon,
The longer they endure, the brighter they grow.
Like the Five Phases,
They wheel and turn without cease.
Some attain the ascension of parents to Heaven,
And blessings of prosperity for descendants.
This is truly the *qi* entering the *Mystery of Mysteries*.

**Chapter Twenty-Three: Cultivating Merit to Achieve Reality**

Who does not desire to attain immortality?
Study immortality in youth.
In youth, serve with loyalty and filial piety,
Accumulating long practice to form a root of goodness.
Moreover, perfect the *qi* and blood,
Ascending and descending within the cinnabar field.
Hold talismans to cure others’ illnesses,
And hidden virtue may transcend the ordinary.
Cultivate practice using my method—
What worry is there of not ascending to Heaven?
I possess the *Scripture of Purity and Luminosity*;
Recite it to learn loyalty and filial piety,
And refine the bodily form.
Spiritual luminaries come to assist,
And thus one may cure a hundred illnesses.
Through this, initiate the primal merit,
And one may reach the realm of immortals.
Escape the gate of afflictions,
Enter the realm of clarity and brightness.
Riding the cloud of the mysterious crane,
One naturally soars through the void.
Should one wish to command ghosts and spirits,
They will follow like child servants.
The *Six Jia* and *Six Ding*—
This method emerges from their origin.
Cultivate merit to achieve reality,
And through this, refine and polish.
Naturally, one obtains my method,
And within a hundred days, sees ghosts and spirits.
How does one assist the Supreme Emperor?
He dispatches them to aid you.
If you are good at upholding the Dao,
Even the various demons and devils
Will wish to pay homage to you.
This is due to the quality of loyalty and filial piety,
And the preservation of true *qi*.
Having merit among the multitude,
One ranks among the immortals’ assembly.
Those who cannot practice this Dao
Will find it difficult to obtain the method.
Even if one obtains my method,
This art will not be efficacious.
If loyalty and filial piety are not in the heart,
*Qi* and blood are lost for the sake of profit.
The Dao of immortality grows ever more distant,
Obtaining the method is like steaming sand.
Steaming sand to make rice,
Expending effort, yet it cannot be cooked.
Though there is the heat of fire and *qi*,
It cannot be eaten.
Among the various immortals of the Southern Palace,
Not one has been heard of who is unfilial.
Practice filial piety to study immortality—
Studying immortality should be easily accomplished.

**Chapter Twenty-Four: The Praise and Concealment of Secret Standards**

The Supreme Emperor arranges offices,
The officials of the various heavens.
The true offices of Heaven’s officials,
Each possesses its wondrousness.
According to what one has studied,
He rewards with secret characters,
Combining them into fine appellations,
To perfect the Supreme Dao.
Serving both parents with devotion is called *filial piety*.
Respectfully serving the lord is called *loyalty*.
Harmony with elder brothers and friendship is called *fraternal duty*.
Amity with relatives is called *harmony*.
Nurturing one’s nature and life is called *authenticity*.
Comprehending the canonical teachings is called *Dao*.
Diligence in rectifying the mind is called *virtue*.
Commanding ghosts and spirits is called *sageliness*.
Achieving utmost sageliness is called *divinity*.
Clarity in perception and understanding is called *wisdom*.
Wisdom that radiates forth is called *numinosity*.
Virtue and conduct that do not change are called *stability*.
Stability that does not change is called *responsiveness*.
Diligence in upholding the Dao and its methods is called *reverence*.
Adherence to precepts and regulations is called *conduct*.
Virtue sufficient to radiate forth is called *manifestation*.
Manifestation that does not waver is called *radiance*.
Radiance of great brilliance is called *excellence*.
Refining the hun and po souls is called *purity*.
Commanding without selfishness is called *resoluteness*.
Collecting many numinous scriptures is called *assembly*.
Substance that may be employed is called *pattern*.
Virtue and conduct that are not deviant are called *verification*.
Universal love without weariness is called *benevolence*.
Beauty that may be praised is called *excellence*.
Possessing all good affinities is called *fruit*.
Reverence without weariness is called *solemnity*.
Such categories as these,
Numbering in the thousands or tens of thousands,
Are all contained in the canonical texts.
Those who study the Dao,
Diligently practice them,
And thus the praise and concealment of secret standards
Arise naturally from within.

**Chapter Twenty-Five: The Jade Regulations and True Mechanism**

The true essentials of the Jade Regulations,
The *Purple Court* and the *Ghostly Azure*.
There is natural meaning,
There is natural clarity.
Diligently cultivate the Orthodox Teaching,
And the Great Dao is accomplished.
Obscured and deluded,
Evil fills to overflowing.
Purity without defilement is called *purity*.
Vigilance and apprehension are called *diligence*.
Desire that is not yet attained is called *authenticity*.
Covetous desire that is not yet attained is called *authentic covetousness*.
Taking what is not to be taken,
Stealing what is not stealing,
Lust that is not lust,
Rebellion that is not rebellion,
Compliance that is not compliance.
Compliance and rebellion, rebellion and compliance,
Good and evil, evil and good.
Repentance and awakening to study the Dao
Are called *supreme goodness*.
Affectation contrary to the Dao
Is called *great evil*.
Life that is not true life,
Killing that is not true killing.
Concealing goodness is corruption,
Hiding evil is deception.
Killing yet wishing for life—
This is called *love of life*.
Seeing and wishing to kill—
This is called *love of killing*.
Those who resent their parents
Cannot obtain life;
Though they live, they may be killed.
Thus, the truly filial do not die,
The utmost filial attain immortality.
The Dao of immortality is easy,
The way of ghosts is difficult.
Goodness is the constant of good people,
Evil is the pretense of evil people.
Goodness, through habitual practice, may become evil;
Evil, if not evil and reformed, becomes goodness.
Thus, those who reveal arrogance receive reward,
Those who secretly accumulate meet execution.
Using pretense to encourage goodness is called *sincerity*,
Using honesty to gloss over faults is called *deception*.
Yin transgressions are great,
Yang transgressions are small.
Transgressions arising within yet not revealed—
The offense is already grave.
Acts performed outwardly yet accompanied by shame—
The offense is already absolved.
Do not suppress others’ goodness;
Those who suppress others’ goodness turn their backs on the Dao.

Though seizing another’s goodness, those who seize goodness turn toward the Dao.

Heaven’s light emerges from earth,
Fire illuminates human radiance—
A mirror by which one may know.

**Chapter Twenty-Six: Penetrating Knowledge of Past Lives**

Illumine the true without obscurity,
Penetrate knowledge of past lives.
Attain former habits,
To cultivate good roots.
Without error or fault,
Study the divine immortals.

What is the Dao of immortals?
Where the numinous nature reaches.
Only through penetrating knowledge
Can one attain the mysterious precepts.
The mysterious precepts are most clear—
Behold my former studies.
With those former studies,
One may repeatedly transgress,
One may repeatedly achieve,
And naturally become true.
Becoming true is not difficult,
Attained only through learning.
Through eternal kalpas unchanged,
True knowledge unconfused—
This is penetrating knowledge.

From that penetrating knowledge,
One reaches penetrating spirit.
From that penetrating spirit,
One can achieve penetrating vision.
What is called *penetrating*?
Dark and light all discerned,
Bright and obscure unshaken—
This is supreme wisdom.

The spirit soars in threes and fives,
Roaming and feasting among the heavens.
Above the heavens,
Each has its true person.
The arts of the true person
Are most clear in meaning.
Purify the viscera,
Nurture the essence-spirit.

The medicine of nature,
Talismans and incantations most efficacious.
There is the celestial drum—
Struck, it resounds mightily.
There is the jade spring—
Drawn, it overflows.
The coming of the jade spring,
The nectar of the flower pool,
Its essence like honey,
Its flavor most true.

Swallow and rinse, sound the drum,
Six by six, complete the cycle.
To preserve my spirit,
Bathe in the moon, wash in the sun.
Sun and moon now bright,
Heaven and earth illuminated.
The myriad forms unfold,
The spirit-soul transcends.

This is the clarity of penetrating vision,
By which to examine ghosts and spirits.
It can illuminate ten thousand miles,
It can illumine one’s own body.
Guarded by ghosts and spirits,
It reaches the subtle and obscure.

**Chapter Twenty-Seven: Reviving the Dead and Restoring Life**

Spittle eases cultivation,
Stroking qi to unite with spirit.
The Five Celestial Great Demons,
Ancestors of the ten thousand spirits.
Summon them to return—
Within, there is a true person.
Preserve life, secure its root,
Gather and guide the hun and po souls.
Return them to their dwelling,
Unshaken, unagitated.
Control them so they do not scatter—
Withered trees bloom anew.

Chaos and obscurity merge,
Converging in the mud-pill palace.
Within the mud-pill palace,
It connects to the crimson palace.
The spirit of the crimson palace,
Returning, reverts to the true.
Thus, dry bones
May live again,
All rising to become human.

At this time, there are:
The Demon Mud,
The Dharma Ancestor,
The Return to True,
The Bewildered,
The Profound Net—
Envoys of the Five Celestial Heavens,
Known as Zhao, Meng, and Wu.
They command the flying hun and soaring po ghosts,
Summoned by secret formulas,
Directed by methods.
As the sovereign of the body,
They are the Dharma Kings of liberating the dead.

There is also the upright qi,
Spread within and without.
Within and without now harmonized,
It reaches the joints.
Unshaken, unagitated,
Suddenly, one attains it.

Then recite the incantation:
*True Person of Reviving Life,
True Person of Saving from Suffering.
Spittle eases cultivation,
Unite qi to merge with spirit.
Hun and po souls return again,
The register of death removes the name.
The Five Celestial Great Demons,
Liberate the corpse’s form.
Let so-and-so live again,
Swiftly, swiftly, as the law commands.*

As for the secret formulas for the eyes and joints preserved in the esoteric texts—
If one encounters a person of karmic affinity,
They may receive and uphold them.

**Chapter Twenty-Eight: The Underworld’s Examination of Forms**

On Mount Fengdu,
There are prisons and cells.
A Great Emperor Lord
Presides over its judgments.
Tens of thousands of demonic nets,
Examine and punish evil ghosts.
Hundreds of thousands of deaths,
Dying and being reborn.
Through kalpas of cyclic rebirth,
They become the six livestock.

Asking the reason—
All due to lack of filial piety.
The five rebellions of unfilial conduct
Stem from the root of the heart.
A foolish heart unrepentant
Soon becomes disobedience.
Disobedience and unfiliality
Transform into disloyalty.
Greed for wealth, greed for beauty,
Greed for wine, greed for lust.
From these causes and conditions,
Many misfortunes arise.
Offending yin and yang,
Provoking heaven and earth.
The twelve double-hours
Record their transgressions.
Reported to the celestial court,
The celestial court issues its decree.
Delivered to the celestial pivot,
Their hun souls are bound,
After death, entering Fengdu.

Those who can recite this scripture
Will have their sins and evils naturally dissolve.
Recite the scripture, practice filial piety and brotherly respect,
Reform conduct, repent past wrongs.
Become a divine immortal,
Naturally ascending the celestial thoroughfare.
The celestial thoroughfare is difficult to ascend—
Practice holds its secret method.
The secret method is not hard to seek—
Filial piety naturally attains it.

Meet with those of insight,
Awaken to the scripture’s meaning.
Understand and strive to practice—
Then escape the paths of Fengdu.
Without abandoning past transgressions,
One may redeem the hun souls of ancestors.
Follow the heart, practice filial piety and brotherly respect—
No need to recite this scripture.
This scripture repents foolishness,
Used to deliver those sunk in suffering.

May all my immortal disciples
Keep filial piety and brotherly respect in their hearts.

**Chapter Twenty-Nine: The Pure and Bright Orthodox Seal**

The myriad methods of the Pure and Bright
Begin and end in forty chapters.
Take filial piety as the origin,
The body as the foundation.
Only filial piety can be studied—
Through it, ascend to the celestial palace.
The celestial palace is originally in the eyes,
Yet my Dharma is not practiced.
Recite this *Pure and Bright Scripture*,
And practice the Pure and Bright Dharma.
The Dharma can dispel a thousand disasters,
And cure the essence of ten thousand demonic spirits.
When merit is complete, it naturally perfects,
Through a thousand kalpas, the body is not lost.

In the hall, an elder of a hundred years,
Within the household, no partiality.
Still, there is a white-haired grandson,
Playing and laughing in the central courtyard.
This is the primordial qi,
Entering the mysterious and profound.
Within the profound precepts,
Thirty-five divisions.
Further, there are wondrous teachings,
Two chapters of the *Numinous Scripture*.

They can extend life to a thousand or a hundred,
See ghosts and spirits,
Transmute gold and jade,
Summon wind and rain,
Save the departed hun souls,
Dispel weapons and war.
Only by firmly upholding my teachings,
Reciting this scripture,
Will divine immortals naturally appear.
With these three chapters,
Teach you to chant and recite them—
Then you may become a supreme perfected one.

Becoming a true person is not difficult—
Study begins with filial piety.
Filial piety and brotherly respect are not hard to practice—
Follow the heart in serving parents.
Parents are originally celestial venerables—
May you awaken to this in your heart.

**Chapter Thirty: The Pure and Bright Numinous Treasure Talisman**

chunks.original_text: 念我净明经，复行净明法。 可以先行孝，次学炼身形。 身形既以安，正炁摄百鬼。 救护诸众生，可以成功勋。 功勋非难积，善学净明经。 净明有宝符，诀目甚分明。 中有灵宝尊，灵宝大真人。 天枢都录事，日直太元君。 掌法行秘科，行之自然灵。 复有大神将，十天大魔王。 四圣大将军，内外十六将。 四直直符吏，为子行灵符，为子兴功艺。 不孝行此法，如彼雪投汤，罪犯自消释，不孝变孝诚。 孝诚成第一，复能救世人。 功积着上天，仙道自然成。 欲知行孝人，复念净明经。 行此净明法，如龙足生云。 龙足既生云，风雷皆汝御，净明宝符灵。 度脱六亲篇第三十一 前一道符，如有人能受持，於父母六亲。 本命之日，用朱砂书符，恰诀存身，为孝道明王。 念咒书符，与其人吞服，自然父母六亲长寿。 后一道符，如有人能受持，於父母六亲。 身死之日，用朱砂书符，恰诀存身，为孝道明王。 念咒书符，烧化和泥，置於亡者心上，即亡者托此法力，回生起死，魂魄受生，自然超度。 已上二符，能至力行持，即道果有基，方可修炼服炁。 又逐日书符各一道，烧则生者蒙福，死者得仙矣。 永为生死解脱之本也。 服炼身形篇第三十二 前付道符，可以飞升天耳。 第二道符，可以开明天目。 天目天耳，达乎泥丸，则服炼身形之要法，所谓化生诸天。 有能恰诀念咒，书符二道，每日朱砂写而吞之，则日月五星之真炁注身也。 服之不饥，自然长生。 写时存为孝道明王、灵宝净明天尊，则天尊降真炁，存于汝身也。 救治百病篇第三十三 前一道回死为生，后一道保命生根。 凡有疾病者，闭目静思，取朱砂恰诀念咒，存身为孝道明王、灵宝净明救苦天尊，丸符咒水以服之，则病者自安。 救治疾病，谓之道力。 以力行道，谓之细积。 以法行道，谓之达道。 以孝行道，谓之上道。 道有上中下三品，此其下也。 然救治百病，愈人疾苦，亦可得仙。 诸行孝服炁，功已圆矣。 得此，则行孝炼炁之羽翼也。 束缚百邪篇第三十四 右符束缚百邪。 凡有坛庙五通作怪之物，为民害，如门户开阖、塘池破坏，皆急取此符念咒恰诀，朱书镇贴，即自消散。 书咒符篆之时，面北存身为孝道明王、灵宝净明天尊，四圣执符而行。 安镇呼召篇第三十五 凡一切呼召风雷、社令、天地一切鬼神，书符烧之，七日即至。 如欲禳谢，用大石书符埋之。 此太上孝道明王、灵宝净明天尊秘篆。 凡书符，存身为其本像。 自有灵书三卷，得遇至人传授。 太上灵宝净明洞神上品经卷下竟
chunks.translated_text:
Recite my *Scripture of Pure Brightness*,
And further practice the Pure Brightness Dharma.
First cultivate filial piety,
Then refine the body’s form.
Once the body’s form is settled,
True qi subdues the hundred ghosts.
Rescuing and protecting all sentient beings,
One may achieve meritorious deeds.
Accumulating merit is not difficult—
Diligently study the *Scripture of Pure Brightness*.
The Pure Brightness holds sacred talismans,
With incantations and signs most distinct.
Within resides the Numinous Treasure Venerable,
The Numinous Treasure Great Perfected One.
The Celestial Pivot’s Chief Recorder,
The Day-Watch Supreme Primordial Lord.
They oversee the secret teachings and practices,
Which, when performed, are naturally efficacious.
There are also great divine generals,
The Ten Celestial Great Demon Kings,
The Four Sage Great Generals,
The Sixteen Inner and Outer Generals,
The Four Watch Direct Talisman Officers.
They act on your behalf to activate the numinous talismans,
They act on your behalf to accomplish meritorious arts.
One who is unfilial and practices this Dharma
Is like snow cast into boiling water—
The transgression dissolves of itself,
And the unfilial transforms into sincere devotion.
Sincere devotion is foremost,
And further, one may save the world’s people.
Merit accumulates and is recorded in the heavens above,
And the Dao of immortality naturally manifests.
To know one who practices filial piety,
Recite again the *Scripture of Pure Brightness*.
Practicing this Pure Brightness Dharma
Is like a dragon’s feet generating clouds.
Once the dragon’s feet generate clouds,
Wind and thunder are all at your command—
The sacred talismans of Pure Brightness are efficacious.

**Chapter Thirty-One: Deliverance of the Six Relations**

The first talisman:
If one can receive and uphold it for parents and the six relations,
On the day of their fateful destiny,
Inscribe the talisman with cinnabar,
Hold the mudra and visualize oneself as the Filial Dao Radiant King.
Recite the incantation and inscribe the talisman,
Have the person ingest it—
Then parents and the six relations will naturally enjoy longevity.

The second talisman:
If one can receive and uphold it for parents and the six relations,
On the day of their death,
Inscribe the talisman with cinnabar,
Hold the mudra and visualize oneself as the Filial Dao Radiant King.
Recite the incantation and inscribe the talisman,
Burn it and mix the ashes with clay,
Place it upon the deceased’s heart—
Then, by the power of this Dharma,
The departed will return to life from death,
Their hun and po souls will be reborn,
And they will naturally attain deliverance.

If one can practice these two talismans with utmost dedication,
The foundation of Dao-fruition is laid,
And only then may one proceed to refine and ingest qi.

Moreover, inscribe one talisman each day and burn it—
The living will be blessed with fortune,
The dead will attain immortality.
This is the eternal basis for liberation from life and death.

**Chapter Thirty-Two: Refining the Body’s Form**

The first talisman bestowed
Enables one to ascend to heaven in flight.
The second talisman
Opens and illumines the celestial eye.
When the celestial eye and celestial ear
Reach the Mud-Pill Palace,
This is the essential method for refining the body’s form—
The so-called transformation and birth in the various heavens.

One who holds the mudra, recites the incantation,
And inscribes the two talismans daily with cinnabar to ingest them,
Will have the true qi of the sun, moon, and five planets infuse their body.
Ingesting it, one will be free from hunger
And naturally attain longevity.

When inscribing, visualize oneself as the Filial Dao Radiant King
And the Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Celestial Venerable—
Then the Celestial Venerable will descend with true qi
And abide within your body.

**Chapter Thirty-Three: Healing the Hundred Diseases**

The first method revives the dead to life,
The second preserves life and roots vitality.
For all who suffer illness,
Close the eyes and meditate in stillness,
Take up cinnabar, hold the mudra, and recite the incantation,
Visualize oneself as the Filial Dao Radiant King
And the Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Savior from Suffering Celestial Venerable,
Form the talisman into a pellet with the incantation water and ingest it—
Then the afflicted will naturally recover.

Healing illness is called the power of the Dao.
Practicing the Dao with power is called gradual accumulation.
Practicing the Dao with methods is called attaining the Dao.
Practicing the Dao with filial piety is called the supreme Dao.

The Dao has three grades—upper, middle, and lower—
This is the lower grade.
Yet healing the hundred diseases
And relieving the suffering of others
Can also lead to immortality.
All who practice filial piety and ingest qi
Have perfected their merit.
This is the auxiliary practice for cultivating filial piety and refining qi.

**Chapter Thirty-Four: Binding the Hundred Demons**

The talisman on the right binds the hundred demons.
Whenever spirits of local altars or the Five Penetrations cause disturbances,
Bringing harm to the people—
Such as doors opening and closing of their own accord,
Or ponds and reservoirs breaking—
Swiftly take this talisman, recite the incantation, and hold the mudra,
Inscribe it with cinnabar and affix it for suppression—
Then the disturbances will naturally dissipate.

When inscribing the incantation and talisman,
Face north and visualize oneself as the Filial Dao Radiant King
And the Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Celestial Venerable,
With the Four Sages wielding the talisman in action.

**Chapter Thirty-Five: Pacification and Summoning**

For summoning all things—
Wind and thunder, earth gods, and all spirits of heaven and earth—
Inscribe the talisman and burn it,
And within seven days, they will arrive.
If one wishes to perform exorcism,
Inscribe the talisman on a large stone and bury it.

These are the secret talismans of the Supreme Filial Dao Radiant King
And the Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Celestial Venerable.
When inscribing talismans,
Visualize oneself in their original form.

There are three scrolls of numinous scriptures,
To be transmitted only upon encountering a perfected person.

Here ends the lower scroll of the *Supreme Scripture of the Numinous Treasure Pure Brightness Wondrous Dao, Highest Grade*.
